review.reviewBody:
I really like Manera's offerings. I own their 2mm lobster gloves and 3mm cap for surfing on the East Coast (VA and NC) in late fall and spring. These boots are a perfect fit. I normally take a size 10 US shoe (43 Europe and 28 Japan), and the size 10 (44 EU) of these was perfect.

I also tried their split toe option, but the big toe area was too tight. However, these round toe boots fit nicely, work really well, and keep my feet warm. The sole is thin and provides a good feel for the board. They seem to be well-constructed and of high quality.
review.name: Fantastic boots

name: X10D Boots 3mm - Round Toe

review.reviewBody: If you don't want the visor and take it off you take out the whole padding. Also it's very tight.. really wanted to like this helmet. I think you're better off with the Libre in terms of air passage and lightness, and of course the fact it has no visor.
review.name: Can't take visor off

review.reviewBody: Bought this helmet and absolutely loved it. Unfortunately, a tree jumped out at me and I was ejected like a fighter pilot in distress. I landed pretty hard on my dome on the trail and the helmet held up wonderfully. There is a small dent in the outer shell and that is it. Completely did it's job and kept me from the hospital or worse. Just ordered another one in a different color. Here's to hoping I don't end up needing another color in the near, or distant, future!
review.name: Love this helmet!

name: Allston Helmet

review.reviewBody: Comfortable for a walk in the City or on the trail. I like them so much that I have bought 4 pairs over the last 8 years.
review.name: Hiking Slippers

review.reviewBody: Excellent product, it was what my husband and I where looking for our trip to Colombia
review.name: My Merrells at Parque Nacional Tayrona - Colombia

review.reviewBody: I like this hiking boot.  They are comfortable and no breaking in period.  This is my 3rd pair Merrell's and never had an issue with any of them.  I use mine for hiking, hunting and everyday use.
review.name: great hiking boot
comment: Thank you for sharing your great experience!

review.reviewBody: Good boot as always, but sizes seem to vary slightly. Short life but great.
review.name: As expected as usual . Great boots

review.reviewBody:
My go to disposable hiking shoes. To be clear I absolutely love these shoes. They are the most comfortable hiking shoes I have ever worn and the grip is like that of an approach shoe. 
Now for the bad... I burned through my first pair in 8 weeks. I got about 200 miles out of them.  Even after my first trip in the chiricahua mountains in AZ I noticed some of the tread on the bottom was damaged. Lugs started coming off and it got so bad the shoes became unwearable due to an uneven feeling on the inside where the tread came off. I thought maybe I got a lemon pair. I tossed those and ordered another and now after just three days of peakbagging I lost a big piece of tread. It is very unfortunate because I absolutely love these shoes but they are just inexcusably undurable for what they are advertised as. Please Merrell fix this!
review.name: Amazing shoes, zero longevity

review.reviewBody: This is my 15th pair of Moab hikers. They are a comfortable, durable shoe that have become my everyday wear .
review.name: Dedicated wearer
comment: Thank you for the excellent feedback!

review.reviewBody: Comfort durability reliability you can depend on !
review.name: Not just for trails an everyday comfort shoe
comment: Thank you for the excellent feedback!

review.reviewBody: I got the Moab 3 mid for my brother, these are the greatest boot ever. So very comfortable. This is his fifth pair.
review.name: It's perfect, so most comfortable
comment: Thank you for your awesome feedback!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had mine for years. They’re my go to shoes. I’ve worn them everywhere from the sands of Normandy, France to the snows of South Lake Tahoe. If I only had three pairs of shoes, these would be one of those pairs.
review.name: From sand to snow

review.reviewBody: Bought these boots to replace some Keen work boots, but liked the looks of them so much that I decided to use them for dress boots
review.name: Moab 3 Waterproof Mid Boots

description: Buy the Outdoor Research Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket for resort skiing. It's great quality and kept me well protected on some particularly windy and snowy days. There is no built-in powder skirt but did not have issues with snow getting under the jacket when falling in powder. Highly recommend this jacket!!
review.name: Excellent skiing shell

review.reviewBody: I have mixed feelings about this jacket. It is an oversized style. Perhaps it is too big for me, but it's the only available size in the color I wanted. I'm not sure I'm keeping it for this reason. However, I know the materials are of high quality, the design features are great, and it was on sale.
review.name: Excellent quality of materials, intelligent design features

review.reviewBody: 10 outta 10 recommend! great skiing shell - good for all types of weather & keeping out wet!!
review.name: Waterproof

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for the "perfect" snowboard jacket and have found very few options that have met the mark. I was looking for a shell that was durable, waterproof, reasonably priced and allowed for movement when riding. This shell met all that criteria, with the bonuses of pit vents, chest pockets, a pocket in the sleeve for your pass and a deep hood/neck that keeps you protected from the cold. I don't normally write reviews, but I was impressed with this jacket and know that I'll be able to use it for snowboarding at the resort (with layers) and also tour in it! The pink and blue colorway is great as well.
review.name: Love This Jacket!

review.reviewBody: great shell -it's def not as comfy as a lined jacket, but holds up well. Runs a little big (got a M and a S and the M was huuuge on me - I'm 5'4 128lbs athletic/slim build)
review.name: Great - runs a little large

review.reviewBody: Wore my new gear this season, and it fared well in wet conditions too! I love having lots of pockets and discovering new places to store my phone, life pass, and snacks. A beautiful sage/light blue color that looks great on the slopes.
review.name: Great for skiing!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit and love the color. I haven't been in a very wet weather with this coat yet, hopefully it is truly waterproof. It will come handy for hiking in the rain as well.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: I'm excited about this jacket. When it arrived I wasn't sure, because although it's really handsome and seems very high quality I couldn't believe it was waterproof. I live in the PNW and we get a lot of cold rain. No doubt it'll work for snow (I haven't tried it yet) but I just wasn't convinced it would work for our wet winters. Well, I finally took the tags off today and took it hiking and it was just perfect. Warm, wind-proof, totally waterproof, quiet, stylish protection. Unzipped a bit it worked great on the uphills, but I was plenty warm enough when I stopped sweating too. I have a really light rainshell but I often get too cold if I'm out for hours in poor weather, and it's very fitted so hard to layer up. But this thing has plenty of room for layers. I would say TTS, it is not as fitted as some jackets but I can fit a full hooded puffy under it. And, it doesn't look "too big" either way. I was looking for a versatile jacket for Oregon and Alaska (where I work sometimes) and I'm really happy with this jacket. Excited to put it through the ringer.
review.name: Excited at the versitility

review.reviewBody: After three winters of trying to (unsuccessfully) find a parka to replace my beloved Isis, I found my next unicorn. I am definitely a pear-shaped, curvy fit, who prefers a two way zipper to give some ease through the hips, and this coat delivers an amazing fit! It arrived just in time for a series of Atmospheric River/"Bomb Cyclone" storms here and it's kept me bone-dry working outdoors in the yard or running errands for a couple hours at a time. Plenty of room to layer, generous range on the wrist cinches, generous hood w/ hood adjustment points. Fabric is fantastic-soft, breathable, hint of stretch. Cut is flattering. My only gripe (which is a barely-gripe) is the bottom half of the 2-way zipper seems a little stiff/reluctant... it may just need to break in a bit. I'm a women's 10-12 on top, 14-curvy on the bottom - bought an XL which has just the right amount of room for winter layers w/ a puffer up top and through the hips/seat. If OR offers fresh colors next year (Berry? Indigo? Teal?), I might consider buying a second one to leave one at home and one in Tahoe. I see why it's an award winner.
review.name: I found my Unicorn!

review.reviewBody: Very nice in coral color 5'7" 135 pounds XS fits very nice with room underneath for a fleece
review.name: Very nice rain jacket, lots of ventilation zips

name: Skytour AscentShell Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Pros:  
High enough off the ground that I can get out of it - which is not true of the Sunset chair.
Arm rests are make a big difference both when sitting and when getting up.
Seat is a bit roomier than the Sunset chair.

Cons:
Whoever designed the storage bag needs to go back to design school and take some lessons in user friendliness. It needs to be an inch wider in diameter.  Folding instructions are not intuitive and it is really difficult to store the chair for travel.
Seat is very short - and I feel like I am falling forward when sitting it it. This is somewhat helped by putting two ball feet on the front but none on the back, but still....
Seat is not roomy enough sitting for different positions - so I don't see sitting in it for hours by a fire.
review.name: Pros outweigh the Cons....

name: Savanna Camp Chair

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Needed to upgrade my Columbias for more serious hiking. These were great out of the box, just hiked 5 days in the Canadian Rockies - rocky, rooty, steep, wet, felt my shoes handled it all very well. I definitely felt my feet lasted many more miles without feeling achey or tired. Very happy with this purchase.
review.name: So far loving

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have two pair of Zanderland and Salomon but these Danners are in a league of their own. They are lighter and are cushioned to the perfect pressure throughout the sole. I haven?t had them through a Park City winter yet but so far they are pretty incredible. I?d size up 1/2 size if you plan to wear a thinker sock.
review.name: Best hiking boots I?ve owned

review.itemreviewed: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These shoes had virtually no break-in period, which is new as someone who's always worn leather hiking boots. I haven't backpacked in them yet, but after two long day hikes, I'm super excited about these light weight, but sturdy shoes. I sized up a half size, which was the right move. I'm a true 7.5 with narrow feet, and the 8 works perfectly. I do most my backpacking in the fall, so I'm eager to see how they keep my feet dry and warm in Minnesota's cooler months.
review.name: Great Alternative to a Heavy Boot

name: Trail 2650 GTX Mid Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the same high quality products I’ve become accustomed to with earlier purchases. Thank you!
review.name: High Quality

review.reviewBody: I have two of these. Use for traveling and at home. It is the perfect size. Great for coffee in the morning and cocktails in the evening. Coffee is hot to the last sip. A whole bottle of beer fits in this cup and is cold to the last sip. I would buy another if there were more color choices.
review.name: The perfect cup

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for left overs and to take to for lunch the next day.
review.name: Perfect set

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are the perfect cup for warm or cold beverages. We have a set we've used for years but wanted some with out the coffee taste. This set will be used for other drinks.
review.name: Perfect evening picnic cup.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this pint size tumbler, it’s large enough to hold a generous amount of coffee yet it’s compact enough to fit in your hand. I love it, it’s perfect for my needs! Sleek and so stylish and super adorable 💕
review.name: Portable, functional and so cute💕

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Small, fits in cup holder, keeps my coffee hot for a long time!
review.name: Small and cute

review.reviewBody: Perfect size, holds the temperature very well... I'll order a pink one to match my big 40oz Hydroflask
review.name: Perfect for my morning coffee

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this cup! It is the perfect size for a cappuccino for the road. I’ve never liked tall insulated cups for hot beverages; it’s very difficult to judge how hot, or how far away the hot beverage is. So this up is perfect for my style of beverage consumption.
review.name: Perfect cappuccino cup!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is the second set of these I’ve bought for my friends. They’re the perfect size and shape to keep coffee hot longer and fit in the cup holders in the car. They’re the perfect gift for everyone so of course they love them. Now I need to get some for myself 😊
review.name: Great gift

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The 12oz. Outdoor Tumblers are ideal when you don’t need a pint glass. We had some and bought more because everyone liked them for both hot and cold drinks so we needed enough for the whole family. 

The tumblers are great, and we may end up buying even more.

The shipping, though did not match the quality of the tumblers. Based on the tracking app, our package Sat in the warehouse for nearly a week before the Carrier picked it up. That was discouraging. In the future, we may just buy from a local store, even if that costs a little more.

Don’t let this shipping complaint dissuade you from getting these tumblers. They are great.
review.name: Buy enough of these tumblers for your whole family.

name: 12oz Outdoor Tumbler

review.reviewBody:
I'm an advanced snowboarder and have realised they are a little too soft for advanced terrain. My shins are in agony after my first day using them.  Recommend in all other aspects but please note size does run a little small. 
I love everything else about them, they are warm, dry, very cute and easy to tighten. Would recommend to beginner or intermediate rider.
review.name: Fantastic all round boot - not for advanced riders

review.reviewBody:
I have been told to go down a size in boots for a snug fit. I typically wear a 9 so I got an 8.5 (which I have wore in rentals and it worked great). 
I think they are perfect, my feet don’t feel smashed or get sore. They loosen up while I ride a little so I tighten them often. 
I have Union Juliet bindings, which work nicely with the boots and look super feme as a pair. Love my set up!
review.name: Pearl Boas

review.reviewBody: I used these boots everyday for a week and my feet have never been happier on the mountain. Not only was I snowboarding but I was also chasing a toddler and carrying a new born while at the slopes and not once did I think about my feet! If you’re looking for a versatile snowboard boot that you will be happy wearing all day, these are a great choice. I used the measuring tips on this website to select my size and they fit perfectly.
review.name: Very comfortable!

description: Buy the Specialized Turbo Pro T5 Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Turbo Pro T5 Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Turbo Pro T5 Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Elimino todas las vibraciones y se siente la bike mas suave cuando ruedas y con mas seguridad al bajar y coger las curvas, lo mas importante ahora al frenar es mucho mas seguro y preciso. No es una goma tan liviana pero la seguridad y el comfort es importante para mi. Su proteción Blackbert ayuda mucho contra los pinchazos. Al mometo todo safe.
review.name: Muy Buena Compra

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been riding the S-Works Turbo tire for years and ordered two of the Turbo Pro’s by accident (was in a hurry). I realized the mistake when they arrived but decided to try them rather than return. They are slightly heavier but not noticeable on the road. Have about 500 miles on them and they look like new, surprising with all the gravel, etc. along our roads. They corner confidently, have worked great in the rain, and are not wearing as quickly as the S-Works Turbo. I ride about 6,000 miles a year and this year looks like 7,000 is possible. I’d typically go through several sets of S-Works and flat a lot. With these I don’t think that’s going to happen, they aren’t showing wear yet. 
A very good alternative to the S-Works version that costs less and I’m kind of glad I ordered them by mistake!
review.name: Great Training Tire

name: Turbo Pro T5 Tire

review.reviewBody: This boot rips right out of the box but alas as with the other review here the buckles aren’t up to the task. After about twenty days the toe buckle rivet blew. The other one on the other boot is just about there as well. Dalbello in NH won’t return calls or reply to emails. It’s a shame because these boots otherwise crush.

review.reviewBody: Not a bad boot while it lasted.  Buckles are just too light to support a supposed 130 flex boot.  The buckles need more reinforcement to secure the shell.  Unfortunately there are no replacement buckles available for purchase at this time.  I've attempted to warranty the boot with no help from backcountry, and now going through a local rep.  They don't make it easy.
review.name: Disapointing Quaility

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of the Bushido goretex shoe. Clearly a fan as I’m on my second pair of the non-goretex Bushido as well. I use them for everyday wear. The waterproof pair is put to use in the winter months and the other as it gets nicer out. It fits my foot well and I like the color. There is a slight sizzling difference between the Goretex & non Goretex.
review.name: Perfect for me - my second pair!

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Fourth pair of La Sportiva’Bushidos.  Love the flexibility of this shoe going from road running to up the side of a mountain. These were stiffer and felt less “bounce” than my previous pairs, same brand same model.
review.name: Fit great from minute I put them on

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really like this brand. Great shoes for me as they provide the necessary solid support that I need. Thank you.
review.name: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: First time I tried this brand. Sturdy, comfortable, and waterproof. I don’t find them to be stiff. I’ll be using them for a hiking trip in Patagonia instead of hiking boots. I usually wear a size 8 US or 39 European. I needed a 40 European.
review.name: Roomy toe box, no heel slip

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought this because it is sturdier and waterproof, however I find the shoe to be too stiff and difficult to laceup tight. The size is too roomy, especially in the heel… I slide around inside the shoe, especially on rough terrain!
review.name: Sturdy, waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased my favorite hiking shoe through backcountry,  it was no longer available on most other sites. I earlier found another item that I had searched all over for, only backcountry found the size and color. I'll start looking 1st at backcountry.
review.name: Great availability for product.

name: Bushido II GTX Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Relaxed Fit Flannel Sherpa-Lined Shirt Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely overjoyed that I made this purchase and now have this jacket! This is my go-to outdoor jacket, especially for walking the dog. The sherpa lining makes it extremely warm and comfortable, and the looser, relaxed fit is stylish while allowing for breathability and easy layering-although it's warm enough that I can comfortably wear a simple T-shirt or light sweater underneath and head outside for an extended amount of time. I purchased it in black which features the signature Carhartt brown color and have received compliments on how it looks, I also love the medium to heavy weight of this jacket and can tell you now I'll be wearing this for the foreseeable future. For reference I am 5'11", 215 which a muscular/athletic build and this jacket in Large is the perfect fit. In summary, Carhartt did a great job with this one-10/10 recommend!
review.name: Perfect Fit, Perfect Weight, and Perfectly Warm

review.itemreviewed: Relaxed Fit Flannel Sherpa-Lined Shirt Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 6'2" 240lbs . Usually a 2 xlt guy because nothing ever fits my arm length. I bought an XLT "one size down". When I say this thing fits prefect I MEAN IT!!!!!. Love the look, the fit, and the over all product. My new favorite coat. Come on cold weather so I can wear it.
review.name: One hard to buy for customer

name: Relaxed Fit Flannel Sherpa-Lined Shirt Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: I've worn Tevas for over 20 years mostly the Mush ii. Was very happy to see a river ready flip flop in the Hydratrek Flip. The sole functioned great but the strap broke while I was at work throwing kayaks.
review.name: Would have been a 5 star had it not broke

review.reviewBody: I want to like these - the footbed is very comfortable and the bottom is grippy even when wet. Problem is that the straps are too large (unless you have very fat feet), and the material they're made from is highly abrasive. This means that they slice up your feet in a hurry - I've been wearing them for a week and it has been bandaid after bandaid to stop them from cutting my feet open. I was hoping they would wear in and stop, but no, it's not getting better. These are going in the trash when I get home from vacation =/
review.name: Straps large and very abrasive

review.reviewBody: I thought the shoe to be too heavy. My heel was guided off to the edge of the shoe and was not comfortable. I donated the pair to Goodwill.
review.name: I could not wear

review.reviewBody: It feels like a high heel. Not a fan. Prefer flat sandals
review.name: It feels like a high heel. Not a fan. Prefer flat sandals

review.reviewBody: I take people all over the world traveling and scuba diving. We all need durable beach shoes and flip flops. I thought this would be perfect b ut I am sending it back, until the design is improved.
review.name: Great product, once they fix the strap, it's too loose

review.reviewBody: So annoying - the 9 is too big for my 8.5 foot. So I exchanged them for an 8 and they sent me ANOTHER pair of size 9! So annoying.
review.name: I exchanged for a smaller size...

review.reviewBody: Busted out my new Hydratrek flips for a boat ride today. First observations: correct fit for size 9. Foot pad comfortable and arch was good. Strap was a little loose but ok. On the boat: stepped in water to unhook boat from trailer. No slippage at all. No slippage from stepping on metal trailer bunk. Sure footing on boat deck. Did not slip on aluminum foot rest while standing on it to put up antenna. ( I did slip doing this with another brand). The sole of the shoe really gives you confidence in wet conditions! Verdict: I love them!
review.name: Confident support in wet conditions

name: Hydratrek Flip Flop - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I will use some insights from a previous review as it describes perfectly these socks:
I would like to echo the previous poor reviews on this product. I too based my size order on the provided size chart which is completely useless. I gave them to my wife as they were way to small for a XXL. She wore them ONCE for 1 hour and the threads are coming apart and they hurt her foot. Castelli needs to revisit the fabric used in this product, because it is JUNK. Very disappointed because all my previous Castelli apparel including socks have been high quality in the past. And now I find out they cannot be returned
review.name: Very poor quality and way off on size

review.reviewBody:
These socks are Airy, superlight, and cushy soft.  Castelli runs small, so size up.  

And if we're gonna talk about the elephant in the corner, I'm 6'3" NOTHING fits me, and i can't dry anything due to shrinking, because EVERYTHING cotton shrinks.  These are like 1.5oz socks, they take 15 min to hang dry.  Folks leaving one-star reviews for shrinking items are just crusty & upset at themselves for their laundry choices.. 

Have a good ride!
review.name: Just size up!

review.reviewBody: I would like to echo the previous poor reviews on this product. I too based my size order on the provided size chart. After one delicate wash and air dry, the socks shrank by 30-40%, rendering them completely useless. I gave them to my wife. Castelli needs to revisit the fabric used in this product, because it is junk. Disappointed because all my previous Castelli apparel including socks have been high quality in the past.
review.name: Junk - DO NOT BUY

review.reviewBody: I am a 11.5/12 in all shoes. I purchased the XXL based on the size chart. Upon first wearing prior to first washing I thought they were a little difficult to get on but once on they were a good precisian fit. Matching the “Pro” in the product description. I wore them one more time before first washing. I wash all my cycling kit in delicate garment bags only together and in cold water and air dry. After just one washing the socks shrank (cold water & air dry) I know this from the fact they were much harder to get on and I had to pull on the bottom of sock to get heal cup onto my heal. The calf tube of one sock had a fabric run. For you ladies think pantyhose run. At the end of a 43 mile ride upon taking them off that same sock with the run ran further. These socks are a disappointment and ended up in the trash can. This is just not acceptable for Castelli or Competitive Cyclist. If I was a one off that would be that. But, look at the amount of other poor reviews on this product. Save yourself from the headache and don’t buy.
review.name: Don’t Buy - Castelli Junk

review.reviewBody:
I buy from this site all the time - love Competitive Cyclist. I also have a ton of Castelli product. 

However, these socks are a disgrace to the brand.

Got XXL for my size 11.5 feet (size 44 euro). After 2 washes and air drying they shrunk to the point where they don't really fit anymore.

Too small. Can't stop it from shrinking. Right/Left specific socks - what a joke. This product should be pulled from the web site.
review.name: Total Waste of Money

review.reviewBody: I have a lot of Castelli kit and I understand that it runs small, at least for Americans.  These socks take it to another level.  XXL is the largest they make and they're slightly too small for my size 13 feet.  It's a bit of a struggle to pull them on but they fit acceptably once on.  The toe seam is a bigger problem for me.  I just can't get it to a comfortable place and that could be because the socks are so tight I can't adjust them.  I'll keep the 2 pairs I bought but can't say I'd buy Castelli socks again.
review.name: Small even by Castelli standards

review.reviewBody: Extremely disappointed. After several uses socks failed (holes). Don’t recommend it.
review.name: Castelli socks

review.reviewBody: I'm size 11.5/12 in shoes bought these in xxl being safe. Couldn't get them on my feet.  Gave them to my 12 year old and still hard to get on but once on very nice quality socks.
review.name: SUPER small

review.reviewBody: used the socks about half a dozen times and. once sock tore with a big hole and the other has a tear down the side already
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: I wear like 40.5 to 41 shoe and finding a sock with a higher cuff length that also fits my foot can be tough. These are perfect! They are left/right specific with some subtle padding in the toe and foot pad area. That 15 cuff comes up right under to slight over the bottom of my calf with a snug fit.
review.name: just right for small feet

name: Rosso Corsa Pro 15 Sock

review.reviewBody:
J’ai de nombreux accessoires MSR (réchaud, casserole…), 2 tentes et je n’ai jamais été déçu. 
Mon ancien Dromadery (10l) avait survécu à de nombreuses conditions à travers le monde. 
J’en avais besoin d’un plus petit (4l) pour transporter l’eau de mon chien. 
 Il est stocké dans les même conditions que mes autres réserves d’eau. 
L’eau a dorénavant un goût effroyable ! Malgré un rinçage systématique, l’utilisation de bicarbonate…
Grosse déception ! Après seulement 2 ans. 
L’ancien a près de 10 ans …
Que faire ?

Sinon le reste de mon matériel MSR est irréprochable.
review.name: Un goût d’eau effroyable

review.reviewBody: Works great but seems the quality isn’t what it used to be. Time will tell.
review.name: Does the job.

review.reviewBody: The first season I used it I was so impressed. Durable and simple to use. But this season the bag is leaving a bad taste like a pool liner. I take care of all my equipment and it was thoroughly cleaned and dried at the end of the season. This year after the bad taste started I tried the recommended quick and deep clean that MSR suggested and it made no difference. Still leaves a bad taste in the water if it sits for more than 6h. The bag is now unusable for drinking water.
review.name: Bad taste

review.reviewBody: I'm an ADV moto rider and the 2L Dromlite fits perfectly in one of my saddlebag pockets. I wish this burlier, more robust bag came in 2L as well so I there's less risk of my bag getting punctured while riding.
review.name: Wish this came in 2L

review.reviewBody:
I used this on one hike and it worked great. I filled it for another hike and it leaked from the small cap.

I bought a new cap and now it leaks from the large cap. Also it does not sit right until the very last tightening turn.
review.name: Leaks

review.reviewBody: I purchased one of these bags years ago and when I tried to use it this summer found it made the water taste so bad it could not be used for drinking. I was assured this issue was in the past by your rep on a phone call. I ordered 2 new ones and found they still make the water taste bad. Not as bad as the old ones but definitely not good.
review.name: Bad Taste

review.reviewBody: When I bought the bag i was excited because I have used a very similar bag in the past. This bag had a distinct rubbery smell and when I put water in it there was an off taste to the water despite multiple times rinsing. I did not take it on my trip.
review.name: Bad taste in bag

review.reviewBody: We realy like the robustness of the Dromedary bag. Although we did not use it very often it was always reliable on our biketrips. But then, when we realy relied on it in the desert like bolivian altiplano, the cap started leaking! We wrote to the warranty support, told them how important the waterbag is for us, but did not get any answer for almost a month! The dromedary bag is supposed to be bomb proof. Bad enough that the cap started leaking, but much worse, if you have to wait so long for support!!! (By the way: The taste of the water is horrible if you keep it in our bag for longer than a few hours! We tried the cleaning with baking soda and lemon a few times, rinsed it at home with fresh water for days, dried it, rinsed it, rinsed it, dried it,... useless. The bad taste stays!) We give two stars because we stilllove the robustness of the bag (not the cap!).
review.name: Cap leaking - Suport not responding

review.reviewBody: The first 4L bag I bought leaked right from the time I purchased it. MSR dutifully replaced it. And that one leaks, too. I've only used it three times, and the leak keeps getting worse. I can't begin to tell you how disappointing this is.Back to a water cube for me....
review.name: Second try, both leak

review.reviewBody: I'm glad I made this purchase. I froze the bag full of water as part of my food storage plan for a multi-day river trip. This bag and some blocks of ice helped my family win the ice war, with ice in our cooler for the full seven days of our trip. Additionally, once the bag thawed, I had some great-tasting water!
review.name: Bought one already, getting ready to buy another!

name: Dromedary Bags

review.reviewBody: Spacious but not bulky. It is my dump everything in and go bag. Thank you!
review.name: Perfect for 3-4 day trips

review.reviewBody:
The bag portion of this bag is everything I wanted - tough, packable/stuff able, and just a little bit of organization.

The straps are everything that I read in other reviews warned about.  It's not like I was expecting Futura in a packable bag...but no carry mode actually works with these straps. They're too short for cross-body, and weirdly unbalanced for shoulder carry.

I honestly plan to destroy them to get the hardware to install on a longer strap.
review.name: Great Bag, Bad Straps

review.reviewBody: it's the perfect bag for a quick trip.  high quality!
review.name: I love it!

review.reviewBody: I used the Mission Duffel on an Ecuador trip, and liked it so much I wanted a lighter version for short and/or light frontcountry trips, mountain biking weekends, etc. The Stuffel fits that bill. It’s a great mix of the right features without getting too fancy with gimmicks.
review.name: Well-executed, versatile bag

review.reviewBody: Easy access, multiple handles/straps for easy transport
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: Had enough space clothes and toiletries for a 4 night trip to Siesta Key FL (you don't need bulky clothes there) then stuffed into shared suitcase with wife. On way home, I used it as a pillow on the plane, and had snack inside too. Kind of expensive as all this vendor's items are...
review.name: Well made, tough, and functional.

review.reviewBody: Bought this because I’ve always loved the Mystery Ranch products I already own. Needed a new duffle bag and found this one. Solid quality and great features. Love it!
review.name: Love the stowaway feature!

review.reviewBody: VERY NICE PACK WITH A TON OF ROOM! I PURCHASED THIS TO MAKE A KILL KIT FOR MY ELK HUNTS!
review.name: NICE PACK!

review.reviewBody: I had return this bag but just want to say how great the company was in helping me with the return
review.name: Great Stuffel, but alas, too big for me

review.reviewBody: Owned this bag for a couple months now. I love the versatility and quality. The material is thicker than I expected, but still able to fold up if needed. Happy with the purchase, price is right.
review.name: Simple, but really well made

name: Mission Stuffel 60L Bag

review.reviewBody: I read the reviews about these pants running small so I sized up, but they’re still way too tight in the thighs! They fit well in the waist and legs otherwise, so it’s a shame. But I would get too annoyed trying to hike in these, so I’m going to end up donating them (since it was a final sale).
review.name: Way too slim in the thighs for outdoors

review.reviewBody:
TL;DR They're fine for casual use, but I wouldn't recommend them for climbing or any other outdoor activity. Black Diamond is having a laugh by charging $100.

Though I do climb, I actually bought these pants with wildlife/nature photography in mind. I was looking for a cotton, relaxed-fit pant with proper pockets for use in the desert during spring when temps are generally mild (lows in the 40s, highs in the 70s). I wanted a pant that'd be suitable for hiking, kneeling, and crouching--all while protecting my skin and holding their own against rocks, vegetation, etc. I thought pants designed for climbing should be perfect in this regard, but I was disappointed in the Credo. Compared to the Black Diamond Notion SP pant, which I also have, the Credo falls short in terms of both durability and fit. The Credo's fabric is undeniably thinner, and even my Notion SP pants (bought Feb 2024) are already showing signs of wear and tear--without even climbing in them. The Credo is also more restrictive than the Notion SP. While it has plenty of movement for a casual pant, there's obvious resistance trying to get a leg high. I think I'd say this even if I were 10-15 lbs lighter too. I bought them on sale for only 30-something dollars, but I still wish I could return them or get myself another pair of Notion SP pants instead.
review.name: Fine for casual but a joke at full price

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for relaxed fit climbing pants and tried Credo and Notion SP (both from Black Diamond).  I am returning Credo because it has the skinny straight cut and much lighter fabric which would be nice for casual strolls in a warm weather, but not durable enough for scrambling, dragging or climbing (would not trust it against rocks and branches).  With the fabric about twice as thick as Credo's, yet feeling soft and comfortable to wear, Notion SP fit the bill (I am writing a review for that separately).

I am about 5'6" and 123 lb, has an athletic build with large thighs/calves and a small waist.  Credo size 2 fit me nicely around the hip and waist (I like that there is no excess fabric around the waist), but the legs are tight and not flattering .  People with the thigh circumference less than 18" may do better (for size 2).
review.name: Credo vs Notion SP (Credo Review)

name: Credo Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I need these a bit wider.

But trying to break in by wearing them my feet go numb.
review.name: A bit snug in ball of foot

review.reviewBody: These are great winter boots. Warm waterproof and comfortable.
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: Love the features of this boot but I could not get my foot into this size W9. 5. My other Keens in this size fit great. Please make a Wide in this model.
review.name: Greta W9. 5 is much smaller than other styles

review.reviewBody: Stylish and comfy right from the box, I did order a half size up questioning when I read Another review. I think I could’ve stayed true to size with them. They seem to be roomy enough in the toe box for me. Will keep them even though they’re a little big just plan on wearing thicker socks in the winter anyway :-) Will update on the tread when we get some snow and ice in the Midwest.
review.name: Good mobility for a winter boot

review.reviewBody: What a great boot! I was skeptical if it was truly waterproof, but I can tell you that it is 100% waterproof! Love this boot! It is very comfortable and your feet will be happy; kind of reminds me of wearing a slipper all day. The insulation is warm on cold days, too. I’m on my feet a lot during the day and this boot has been nothing but comfortable. My size runs between and 8. 5 and 9 and in this boot I went with a 9. Highly recommend!
review.name: Love this boot!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Too small so returned for now. Wanted to leave a review anyway, because they are nice and they would have been my second pair but this time around they ran a little small both by width and length.
review.name: Returned but liked!

review.reviewBody: These feel so good on my feet, right out of the box. I'm excited to wear them this wet season here in the PNW.
review.name: So comfortable right out of the box, and super cute!

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these boots! These are my favorite winter and rain wear daily. They do run 1/2 a size smaller. I have a pair and wanted a back up pair in case something happens to the pair I have, long lasting and comfortable.
review.name: Love these!!

review.reviewBody: Disappointed... I bought these thinking that they were the comfortable Keen shoes I know with big toe box. I probably own 10 pairs of Keen shoes because they are for wide feet. I even gave a pair to someone with wide feet stating that Keen are the most comfortable shoes. I went on a hike to break into them. My small toes got blisters...they are uncomfortable even though I got 1/2 a size up. I can't wear these. They give me blisters. Please bring back the Keen with wide toe box.
review.name: Small toe box causes blisters

review.reviewBody: I’m sad these didn’t work out. They were handsome boots and seemingly comfortable except for the toe band that left my toes numb. I have narrow feet and tried loosening the laces. Seems like an error in manufacturing. I returned them.
review.name: A beautiful boot with an extremely narrow toe

name: Greta WP Boot - Women's

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have some old Assos  bibs that I love but they are starting to wear out. I have been in search of  a replacement since I don’t really like the fit of the new Assos bibs. These fit and feel great, quality and attention to detail is first class. They are a bit shorter which I really like, seems like shorts have gotten longer. Like them enough to purchase a second pair and are now my go to short.
review.name: Replaced my Assos bibs

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I will start by stating the obvious - these are short!  It is literally in the name of the garment.  If you have long legs or don’t want them higher above your knee then don’t buy them.  There should be no reason these get a poor review because of length.  With that out of the way…I currently have four pair of FR-C Pro Bibs in my closet, with three of them being the 5cm shorter variation.  I suppose I could stop my review there, but I will point out the couple of minor things that could be tweaked later on.  I don’t believe that anything can possibly be perfect, but these are so good I have gone for a full 5 stars.  Keep in mind that bib fit, style and comfort are all subjective, but these work remarkably well for me.  The straps are supremely comfortable whether or not you wear a base layer, the mid-section wrap is super soft and will not cut into your stomach, and the chamois is great.  High density, really nice chamois cover, and it stays nicely in place.  I have well in excess of 2,000 miles per pair (on the first three) and despite many hours, and many washes, the chamois are all still performing…although starting to get broken down a bit.  Additionally, the high durability lycra on the inside of the leg makes a massive difference to the longevity of the bibs.  After several thousand miles only my oldest pair is even starting to show signs of wear.  The only minor critiques I can offer are as follows.  The stitching around the outside of the chamois is for both the cover and the pad, so over time little bits of the edge of the foam will start to pull out and/or separate…but this is after a great many miles.  Aside that, the elastic hem at the bottom of the leg requires an extra seam compared to bibs that offer a laser cut leg opening.  If those two items were to be addressed I dare say I wouldn’t even look at other brands or models for the foreseeable future.
review.name: Favorite Bibs.  Period.

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: God send in my opinion. I’m 5’4 and most other shorts are too long, so from a sizing much appreciated. Plus one of the higher end garments from the manufacturer. High quality compression, flat stitching, great chamois. Perfect for endurance riding, dirt or road. I have a Leadville buckle wearing these. Honestly good value since they hold up quite well to tough conditions over the years.  Since there is good compression in the material may need to size up accordingly to get the feel you want .
review.name: Perfect for short legs

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I a’ 5”4’ And 62 kg.   Medium fits great but they are a bit short even on me.   But nothing really else on the market fits me, so here I am.     It’s very comfortable and well made    They also wear pretty well even after many washes
review.name: My go to bibs

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
The negative reviews seem to follow a trend of people not liking the sizing. From my experience, Giordana run perfectly to their size chart. The FR-C is performance/race fit. Sounds like a lot of people didn't use the size chart or understand Giordana's different lines. You'd probably be better off with the Fusion or Silverline.

These bibs are light, have a great feel, and have been incredibly comfortable. The shorter length of these give the quads a bit of air and focus compression a bit higher on the legs. The straps also seem to melt away on the bike, and that is the best compliment one gave give to straps in my opinion. These are my go-to for summer training and perfecting the tan. 

5'9 185lbs, big quads, size Large are spot on.
review.name: Literally perfect

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: before i purchased i read all the reviews and most mention sizing up. im 6' 1.5"  192lbs with a 33 waist, so i bought an M, L and XL intending to return the 2 that dont fit. well the medium fit the best. yeah its a little tight in the legs, but my sit bones are landing right in the middle of the wide part of the chamois. the large felt more comfy in the fit but my sit bones were toward the front of the chamois and the XL my sit bones were on the edge with little padding, with the wide part more higher up on my cheeks. However testing with my black underwear you can see the seam in my underwear running between my cheeks, so they don't pass the butt Crack test. A simple extra layer of fabric for a few inches above the chamois would solve this. I ride on the beach in the sun this is not gonna work
review.name: Everything is perfect except...

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've worn Pearl XXL as my go to bibs, and bibs from Gore, Castelli, DeMarchi, Specialized & Capo in either XXL or 3XL that matched up size wise.  I was eager to try these from Giordana, but I couldn't even pull them on over my thighs because they are so small.  The leg openings belong on a size L at best. Big guys who need top level shorts often have huge legs.  I don't think I could have gotten these on back when I was an XL sized teen riding 300 miles a week.
review.name: XXL?  Maybe in kids' sizes?

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
These are race sized & meant for holding hoods or drops!   
Straps: nice n wide & set for racing. Thus when standing they?re tight and hard to get on. 

Shorter length: Awesome,  wish other lines were available in -5 (besides top tiered & priced Giordana  lines) 

Compared to Moda line  legs & seating area is also much tighter. 

I typically wear size XL in Giordana bibs & have a pair of L and these XL felt like M-L.
review.name: Runs small

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 5'4" and bought this because average bib shorts usually go to my knees. These are the opposite. They are like 'short shorts.' I feel very strange seeing that much of my leg in cycling shorts and so they are going to be a return.
review.name: Be careful about the length.

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Comfort? Check.
Quality? Check.
Right length to maintain proper tan lines? Check.
Price? You get what you pay for :-)

I switched from Rapha recently and have really enjoyed these. The only thing I don't love about them is the straps (I think they could have made them a bit wider) but it is a non-issue while on the bike. I use these while road and gravel riding, as well as XC mountain biking. The 5 cm shorter length is much appreciated as I don't like bibs that come way down to my knee cap. I used the sizing chart and found the fit to be true to size (using actual measurements and not pants waist measurement).
review.name: My new favorite bibs

name: FR-C Pro Bib 5cm Shorter Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The all-leather Torin has the great features of the Torin runners.  Wide toe box, excellent cushioning, solid support.
I have worn them on full-day urban excursions and been very happy.
review.name: Love the Altra Torin!

review.reviewBody: I bought these a while ago and they fit great. I work in a kitchen and they’re holding up pretty well. I tried to walk on a freshly mopped floor to test out their slip grip and they’re really slippery. Whenever there are spills on the ground, I make sure to be very careful because they don’t have the best traction. My work crocs had much better slip resistance than these. Other than that I think they are very comfortable and the right support I’ve been looking for.
review.name: Great fit, NOT slip resistant

review.reviewBody: I'm on my feet all day working in a restaurant kitchen. I've had 3 pairs of these shoes, they are literally the best and most comfy shoe I've found for standing all day. My feet used to ache all day in every other shoe, but these are so cushy!
review.name: My favorite work shoe

review.reviewBody: These brand of shoes are extremely comfortable. I am on my feet all day and I prefer this brand over any other!
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: I'm a rural carrier. On my feet for hours a day. In and out of vehicle over 75 times/day. We are required to wear tie up, leather shoes. These are approved and are amazing. Fit well, light weight, and cradle your feet. Makes the day much better. Wish they came in blue, and other colors.
review.name: Lifelong customer!

review.reviewBody: It's really hard to find a comfortable shoe for someone with a wide toe box and narrow heel. These felt amazing since day 1, I can finally be on my feet all day long without pain!
review.name: Best wide shoe ever for nurses!

review.reviewBody: I WORSHIP these shoes! I'm a GM in the restaurant world and these save my life. I clock 20k steps a day in these for 6 months and then buy a new pair. The days these aren't produced anymore will be the end of me.
review.name: I will buy these shoes until I die!

review.reviewBody: I just bought these. It has only been 3 weeks and already the tread is pulling away from the shoe. It is a shame because the shoes are really comfortable and they saved my hip & knee issues which developed from heel to toe drop shoes.
review.name: Tread already peeling away!!

review.reviewBody: Work all day in comfort. Knees feel better. Love how soft the leather is. Nothing negative to say.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: I needed some black leather shoes for work. I’d been wearing another zero drop brand that had no cushion whatsoever and my feet were crying at the end of the day. These have a crazy thick sole, which felt so weird at first since I had already transitioned to mostly “barefoot” style shoes. I’m not sold on the barefoot idea, but I like flat shoes with room for my toes. These actually ticked all my boxes. The only weird thing is the toe rise, but I guess that’s just what you get with running shoes. I occasionally have numbness in my toes from it, but it’s been a small price to pay all things considered. These were my first pair of Altras and I will definitely be buying more.
review.name: Amazing shoes

name: Torin 5 Leather Shoe - Women's

hasVariant.name: XT PD-M8120 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano XT PD-M8120 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Well construction of the pedals, fit good on my shoes. Feels comfortable run my bike.
review.name: Great set of pedals. Im pleased with it

review.reviewBody: I've been using Campy Record Pro-Fit pedals for decades, but finally got tired of replacing plastic cleats, only being able to enter the pedals from one side, and no longer being able to find replacement parts.  I modernized by getting these pedals.  They provide a solid platform for all kinds of pedaling (long uphills, standing on the pedals, etc.). They are easy to enter and release.  Matched with Sidi shoes, they are perfect.
review.name: Great Pedals for a Tandem

review.reviewBody: After one season of use, these pedals have developed play at the axle on both. Unfortunately, these haven't lived up to the reputation of Shimano pedals being bombproof. Warrantying them directly thru Shimano. Hopefully, the warranty goes without issue. Disappointed to say the least!
review.name: Axle play

review.reviewBody: If you want a set of clip less pedals that just work, these are for you. I’ve used shimano pedals for many years. They can be smashed off countless rocks, roots, and anything else. Service is simple. I believe these are a better option than XTR. They are only slightly heavier, more durable, and notably cheaper.
review.name: The best shimano pedals

review.reviewBody: Bought these pedals after wanting a bigger platform for those moments when you unclip and still want some leverage, and also to reduce foot numbness. I had switched over to Crank Bros. pedals but didn't like the clip in/clip out feel with that brand. Happy to return to SPDs and love the feel of these!
review.name: Solid pedals!
comment: Do these larger platform pedals really reduce numbness as there might be more area on the pedal for your feet to access? But you would think in a high quality carbon fiber shoe there wouldn't really be any difference on how much area the pedal has?

name: XT PD-M8120 Pedals

review.reviewBody: Jacket is pretty legit. I just took it to Alaska and it was about 38° average and I wore this jacket with a long sleeve underneath, never got cold. The best thing about this jacket is that it folds up really small so I can fit in my carry-on luggage. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Very nice jacket

review.reviewBody: So far love this jacket. Used for some hikes here in Alaska and has kept me nice and warm for some pretty long hikes. Easily packs and so far super durable breaking through the backcountry. Will see how it does in the winter.
review.name: Great jacket for Alaska fall

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago and I’ve won’t it most days. It’s very comfortable and warm and fits as I expected.
review.name: Very nice jacket!

review.reviewBody: I bought this for cold 20 degree and warmer days and it is much warmer than I had expected.  The insulation felt thin out of the box but after wearing on 3 cold days and nights without much concern of layering underneath, I was pleasantly surprised by the warmth.  It might not be my answer on those zero degree days, but I prefer this over my Marmot heavy down jacket because it doesn't have the bulk.  6'1", 200 lbs, 34" waist and I got an XL which fits great.
review.name: Perfect

name: Lifaloft Hooded Insulator Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Ooni Koda 2 Max Oven online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Koda 2 Max Oven
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ooni Koda 2 Max Oven online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent pizza oven! We use it multiple times a week and the results are amazing. It heats up fast, keeps heat well even for cooking 3+ pizzas in close succession. The size is great for larger or multiple pizzas and an evenly cooked crust.
review.name: Amazing pizza oven

review.reviewBody:
This thing is amazing so far. First time making neopolitan at home, used sourdough starter for dough. 
Oven was left on for almost 45 minutes on full blast but wouldn't get above 715F. After baking one pizza, the bottom was a little underdone, so I lowered the heat on both burners. After lowering both dials the oven some how cranked up to 760F and was rising. Idk what's up with that. Lowering it further then got the temp lower eventually. 
Also the right side reads 30-50 degrees hotter than the left side when both dials were at the same setting.
Either way I'm excited to keep using this thing. It's a beast.
review.name: Great fun oven, spacious, uneven heat though

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We were heating it up to make some napoletana and It just couldn't get up both sides to the maximum heat. We gave up after 90 minutes of max heating.
review.name: Couldn't heat it up in 1 hour

review.reviewBody:
As true pizza—or should we say “zza”—lovers, we’ve tried almost every pizza maker out there, but nothing compares to the taste and design of Ooni! If you’re a fan of authentic Neapolitan pizza like us (and maybe even channel your inner Dave Portnoy), this is the pizza maker you need in your life.

We own both the small and large Ooni models, and they’ve been game-changers for our pizza nights. We grab fresh dough from our local pizza shop, and in just 5-7 minutes, we’re serving up restaurant-quality pizzas right from our backyard. The results? Crispy, perfectly charred crusts and that authentic wood-fired flavor—all at home!

Ooni’s quality and performance make it stand out from all the “off-the-shelf” pizza makers we’ve tried in the past. A big thanks to Ooni for making such amazing products. Keep innovating because you’ve got lifelong fans here! 🍕🙌
review.name: Ooni Review: A Pizza Lover’s Dream Come True

review.reviewBody: Why put the pizza on bricks if your just going to scorch it from the top at 800 degrees? The bricks should be doing the cooking not pouring flame out the sides. Probably good for people looking for a fun little project but not a quality design.
review.name: Cooks top down

review.reviewBody: The Koda 2 Max has been great for finally getting huge NY style pizzas done in an Ooni. Obviously all Ooni's can get up to a hot temp and cook a great pizza, but the size and versatility of this one has been really great for my needs of cooking for the family
review.name: Koda 2 Max is great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing guys you guys should work on a restaurant size oven
review.name: Great oven

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My first night cooking went well but as we live near the coast it is often windy. The temperature fluctuated quite a bit and it took quite a while to get it above 600 degrees F. The first pizza I slightly over cooked the cheese so a flashlight is now a part of my must haves to detect the degree of cheese browning. I also do believe that I will be using less toppings vs more as the crust is done so quickly. Since the Koda 2 Max was just released for natural gas I am not sure if the gas could be limiting the temperature or if it is just hard to heat up such a large cooking surface. My second night was far less windy and while it did heat more quickly it never reached 700 degrees F.
review.name: My first night cooking went

review.reviewBody: I’ve used the Koda 16, Karu 16, and now the Koda 2 Max. The Karu 16 was the easiest to cook with, as it didn’t require adjusting the flame or temperature. The Koda 2 Max cooks great as well, but you need to turn down the flame while cooking. This greatly saves time and allows you to cook two Neapolitan pizzas at once, which is perfect for hosting parties and making multiple pizzas. I would highly recommend it.
review.name: Effortless Cooking with the Koda 2 Max: Perfect f

name: Koda 2 Max Oven

review.reviewBody: Beautiful outdoor jacket perfect for the arctic adventures and warmth is what makes it
review.name: Like what they warm as climbing Mount Everest their parka say it all

review.reviewBody:
Love most of this jacket. Down in collar tends to gather on one side leaving weird feeling.  Most of jacket is awesome and warm but few spots seem to have little to no insulation.  Zipper is tricky.  

Jacket is close to perfect but it’s not!
review.name: Absolute zero jacket

review.reviewBody: This bad boy is one top-notch parka. It’s got abrasion-resistant material in the sleeves. 800-fill down. And not a heavy parka at all.
review.name: Absolute Zero parka is a winner

review.reviewBody:
The warmest jacket ever.
Will be testing it at 18500 feet, highest peak in Mexico.
Club Alpino Mexicano BC -Mexican Volcanos Exped 2023
review.name: Got warmed up just looking at it.

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket last winter and from day one I had small issues with the zipper as the fine teeth caught sections of the coat when doing up to the point it ripped a small portion near the top. I started using it again this winter and the teeth on the zipper failed after 2 weeks of using it this year. Fine tooth zippers on this type of jacket is not a good choice. Parka is great for warmth but the zipper is poor.
review.name: Zipper Problematic

review.reviewBody: I received it last week from a reputable online seller and upon inspection I discovered one of baffles is completely empty! This is a brand new jacket with tag attached! With this being a winter expedition jacket I was really surprised that this defect would happen.. especially being Mountain Hardwear. I always had great experience with this brand but this time it had really let me down. With the price it this shouldn’t happen at all. I was very disappointed
review.name: Empty baffle for a winter expedition jacket

review.reviewBody: I wrote a review earlier.  I anticipated this day it seems.  Zipper failed.
review.name: As expected... Zipper failed

review.reviewBody: If you want to look like a ridiculous Michelin Man, this is your jacket. The good thing is that you’ll be ridiculously comfortable. Turns -30 C into T shirt weather. Every time I wear this jacket, I find some little feature that’s extremely well thought out AND well executed. The wrist cuffs seen odd at first, but I’ve cone to love them. The point of origin of the cuffs in mid-forearm let’s you pull your hands up into the outer sleeve for a quick warm up. Just the other day I discovered little fine mesh windows in the cuffs that let you look at your watch without taking your outer glove or cuff off. The face shield tucks away nicely into little garages - again, well thought and executed. There’s 11 pockets. The lower patch pockets on top of the zipped pockets are a bit tight and hard to access with the vey tenacious velcro. A bit of bellowing and zipper might may have worked a bit better for use in cold weather. The little shopping list pocket on the left sleeve is useful - there may be a technical use, but for now it’s the shopping list pocket. Mountain Hardwear should be really proud of themselves for this one. 6/5 score if they’d let me. I’ve worked in the Arctic in th past, and would like to have had this jacket.
review.name: Ridiculously Good

review.reviewBody:
Over all a grade of 97% - this thing is warm and allows mobility.  Worn in winds up to 40 mph and wind chills of -40 I sweat walking to work in the Arctic Circle (USA).

However, all said and done, this being a MERCEDES of a coat for Arctic daily life, the ZIPPER WILL FAIL.  I anticipate sending them back for repair in the summer.
review.name: Arctic Circle Endorsed/Zipper Will Be First Failure

review.reviewBody:
This parka exceeded my expectations.  Seems very well made with numerous pockets.  I really like the hood function with multiple adjustments.  It is heavy and bulky but that is the exact reason you should be buying this jacket.

I am very thankful for all the reviews discussing the sizing as it runs very big.  IMO you should size down 1 full size with this jacket.  I normally wear a Large, 5'9" and 185 and the medium fit me perfect with room for a couple layers.  If you are going to use this jacket for high altitude mountaineering (I am not) you may want to stay with your original size for multiple layering.

Excellent zipper and velcro functions.
review.name: Excellent

name: Absolute Zero Down Parka - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: Across the board they have reduced the amount of. These used to be 79% wool and now only 56%. A known fact that anything under 80% become much less effective.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sock used for everyday use and hiking. Aesthetic, comfortable and warm. Wears out somewhat fast. Previous packaging preferred: hiking, trekking, mountaineering.
review.name: My Standard Wool Sock

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lots of cushion, work great!
review.name: Great socks with lots of cushion

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable socks, mostly use for cold weather hiking, camping, or house life.
review.name: Nice Socks

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased both the full and extra cushion hike crew socks, which allows me to adjust to current weather conditions. Both socks are comfortably padded and warm. I do prefer the previous product packaging/labeling (hiking, trekking, mountaineering), as this is clearer and simpler. Socks can wear out a bit rapidly, but nevertheless Smartwool socks are my favorite and I recommend them.
review.name: Review - Hike Classic Crew Socks

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Can always add these to the kit.
review.name: I've been hiking in this version for over 20 years

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have always enjoyed the comfort of these socks and their durability is unmatched in my opinion. I have some SmartWool socks that are 15 years old or more and are still in excellent condition. I will add that I wear these socks for work, hunting, fly fishing as my primary sock with stocking foot waders, hiking and casually throughout the house almost every day of the year. Great product.
review.name: Every day wear

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great sock. Thick material and extra warm. My go to sock for the winter months. A must have for me. Sock stays in place and doesn't shift around.
review.name: Must have every winter

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These extra cushion socks are wonderful in my husbands work boots!
review.name: High price reason for gift purchases only!

review.itemreviewed: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very warm and comfortable
review.name: Warm for all seasons

name: Classic Hike Extra Cushion Crew Sock

review.reviewBody: These are pretty standard hammock straps. They do their job and do it well.
review.name: They work

review.reviewBody: Eno is the best in my experience. Whether purchasing for myself or gifts for family Eno is my go-to always. These straps are awesome along with the Hammock!
review.name: Great deal on proven straps

review.reviewBody: Been wanting an eno hammock for years and what better time than a Cotopaxi/eno collab!?? Absolutely love it!
review.name: Love!

review.reviewBody: My kids and I love hanging a hammock up at the river, the skatepark, and even the yard. I love the versatility of the straps! We are set anywhere we go!
review.name: Stoked on double nest with multi point straps!

review.reviewBody: Replacement for the original straps I bought years ago- great product!
review.name: Great straps!

review.reviewBody: Not only was the hammock easy to set up, but it was very comfortable. It’s compact and lightweight making it perfect to travel with. I was nervous it wouldn’t be easy to fit back into the bag, but it took no effort at all. Very very happy with it!
review.name: Unbelievably comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love this hammock set! Got the Cotopaxi xEno hammock and straps and try make for a lush forest stay.
review.name: Hammock love

review.reviewBody: Really simple to use after I finally found te close enough to use my hammock. Blocked chilly wind better than I expected and love the unique colors of Cotopaxi’s design. Keeping it in my car ready for any opportunity to use it again.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for my wife so she could experience hammock camping and hammock hanging in general. They are easy to use and protect the trees. Love these!
review.name: At last the Atlas straps

review.reviewBody: These straps make setting up my hammock a breeze.
review.name: Super easy.

name: Atlas Hammock Suspension System

review.reviewBody: Great fit, super durable, I wear them everywhere. Definitely order a half size bigger like other comments suggests
review.name: I want another pair

review.reviewBody: These shoes perform like a skateboard in general. They hold up well and grip rock while traversing over. However, they leave quite a bit to be desired in terms of our support and general cushion for hiking into the crag.
review.name: Decent approach and casual shoe

review.reviewBody: Nice shoes, but they are very small, I had to return them
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! They are so comfortable and work for many uses. Would definitely recommend
review.name: Would definitely buy these again

review.reviewBody: Has deffects
review.name: Never buy it again

review.reviewBody: Solid shoe. Comfortable with a stiff Vibram sole but in a good way. I get lots of compliments. Casual yet adventurous. Seems to be on the smaller size. I have lots of TNF shoes and some are 10, some 10.5. I probably should be in an 11.
review.name: Casual yet adventurous. Yes I'd buy these again.

review.reviewBody: These are a stylish shoe that can be worn on most occasions.
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: Great shoes. Minimal break in period. Tread is super grippy. Slightly narrow in the toebox.
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: These are great shoes, except for the sizing. I normally wear size 11, but occasionally size 11.5 for a particular tight-fitting shoe. I ordered size 11.5 Clyffes, and they are even tighter than any of my size 11 shoes.
review.name: Great shoes....except for the sizing

review.reviewBody: I bought this for everyday because I like wearing something that's capable for when I inevitably end up outside of the city. The outsole is portably overkill but it's nice to have and it definitely delivers. I was surprised how easily the Cordura stained but now it looks worn and the fabric is so far undamaged. I was also surprised how flexing the shoe is given it's inspired by approach shoes and I personally like a stiff shoe. I generally don't like the direction The North Face is headed but this is a solid show that's stylish in a more simple way than much of there other new offerings.
review.name: The North Face delivered

review.reviewBody: I switched from cleated pedals to platform on my mountain bike, and I'm really glad I made the switch. The Deity pedals have been fantastic! As a road cyclist for my whole life, I like the feel of being clipped. But, since taking up mountain biking, I haven't felt as confident being clipped in on my mb. These pedals give me secure footing while making it much easier to step off when needed. Nice wide design and very effective pegs help keep my feet securely on the pedals. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great pedals

review.reviewBody: I’m on my 3rd set of BladeRunners, these pedals are the best on the market, they can take a genuine beating and the bearings never have problems. I’d recommend these over any pedal on the market in this price point! You won’t regret buying these.
review.name: Best pedals out there!

review.reviewBody: These go round and round and make my bike look good. Solid pedals. Can’t go wrong with Deity
review.name: Round and Round

name: Bladerunner Pedals

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like the length - it is difficult to find longer length fleece/jackets for those cool days when fall/winter jackets are too much. It's cute but perhaps a little too boxy looking with an unstructured shoulder and back. The side pockets are at a bit of an odd location.  With all that, it allows for layering and has been my fall jacket.
review.name: Warm and cute, if not a bit boxy

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I look like a big purple grape walking down the side walk with my dog. I've been wearing this warm fleece in the chilly mornings when I take the dog out. It does keep me very warm. I like the large pockets. I put my phone and keys in them. I debated between the medium and large sizes. If it helps, I'm petite and wear a size 10 and would normally buy a medium in most non-numbered clothes.  I ended up choosing the large because I wanted to wear layers underneath. It's still rather large but I do like that it keeps me warm. I've opted this for  the down coat so far. Mornings have been in the 40s and 50s so this has done the job.
review.name: I look like a big purple grape

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this fleece! It's warm and long enough to cover your butt..such a luxury these days!
review.name: Roomy and Cozy

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Based on other reviews I sized down. I normally wear a medium in coats because I like the extra room for layering and comfort.  The small fits me perfectly and is roomy without looking boxy.  I can easily fit bulky sweaters and sweatshirts under the coat.  I wore it in 30 plus degree weather walking the dog and I was very warm. The sleeves are just right and I like the length.
review.name: Warm and Cozy Coat

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the color and cut, but it’s too big. I could make this work if the sleeves weren’t so long. I so wish it came in XXS. It’s warm and the orange color has teddy bear vibes.
review.name: Very oversized

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This jacket is the love child of your jacket that fits you perfectly but is a touch too tight and your spouses oversized fleece that’s soooo comfy but looks like you’re swimming in it.  It’s oversized in all the right ways while not looking enormous. 
I bought my normal size and it fits exactly how I wanted it to. It’s super cute zipped up or open and blocks the wind.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Based on other reviews I ordered XS instead of my usual size S, even then it was a bit loose for my taste but it's very warm and what I was looking for
review.name: loose and warm

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very warm and good length.  Not very soft and somewhat stiff but kept it because the length and warmth make it a good choice for Montana winters.
review.name: Very warm

review.itemreviewed: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the design and quality but be forewarned - it’s extremely oversized. I was swimming in the XL, which is my usual size.
review.name: A very oversized fit.

name: HiCamp Fleece Long Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
