description: Buy the Thule Chariot Glide/Urban Glide Rain Cover online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chariot Glide/Urban Glide Rain Cover
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Glide/Urban Glide Rain Cover online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Keeps the rain off, but is sorely lacking in structure. It needs some stiff metal or plastic ribs to hold its form. Instead, the clear part just hangs down and doesn't stretch tight enough to avoid drooping onto our kid's toes. Add the weight of rain or, especially, snow, and it droops even more. 

Our kid is only 1 year old and is 50th percentile size all around, so this should not be a problem we're running into yet, if at all. We also have two other strollers, and this is the only cover that has this issue.
review.name: Good, but too loose

review.reviewBody:
Disapointed with organizer and rain cover at same
I want to start saying that I love Thule products, and I love my Thule Urban Glide 2 and I have both, the Thule Organizer and the Thule Rain Cover and I feel disappointed with them when using them combined. The organizer can not be really used because the rain cover does not have an openings (that can have velcro to close it if the organiser is not being used) for the Organizer latching system. I tried to mount the Organizer over the fabric of the Rain Cover and the fabric ripped in two areas where the Organizer locks over the mounting bar of the stroller (Pictures attached).
I think Thule has a big room for improvement to encourage the consumption of Thule accessories, considering the prices for them as well.
Besides that the Rain Cover Does not have an opening/window over the Black Fabric area that goes above the Canopy of teh Stroller that allows me to see my Baby, so constantly I have to stop and go to the front of the stroller to check my baby up.
review.name: Coverand-Organizer no good no window to see baby

review.reviewBody: Yes, it is great to have a rain cover and it is easy to put on. However, it is bulky to pack up and doesn't come with a container. It would be great if it came with a drawstring bag to put it in and toss in the storage area. Also, there isn't a clear window the lines up with the top flap that opens on the sun shade to check on baby while strolling. My little loves to look up at me when we walk, and I think this is a big missed feature of the rain cover.
review.name: Does the job

review.reviewBody: Perfect and easy to put on and take off.  It actually come in handy the last time we went hiking as it started to rain/snow, so definitely worth the investment.
review.name: Great coverage!

review.reviewBody: This is a very useful tool for unexpected showers or rainy winter weather. Don't let the elements stop you from living!
review.name: Very Useful Accessory

review.reviewBody: We haven’t used this for rain, but it definitely holds up for the snow! I was worried that he wouldn’t be able to see through it like some, but no complaints so far!
review.name: Love this add-on

review.reviewBody: The fit is decent. I thought it would fit a little tighter. Velcro needs to either go or the Velcro patches need to be a bit bigger
review.name: Decent fit

review.reviewBody:
Works just as needed. Easy to attach, keeps baby + stroller fabric dry, and doesn't fog up or seem stuffy from the inside. Once we're home, we hang ours over the door to dry out, and roll it up once its completely dry (rolls up to about the size of a water bottle). It would be nice for it to come with a stuff sack; we use a small drawstring bag to keep it in, and store it under the stroller for easy access when needed. The rain cover doesn't protect the organizer attachment, FYI.

Price is definitely worth keeping baby cozy and dry!
review.name: Does the job well

name: Chariot Glide/Urban Glide Rain Cover

review.reviewBody:
For a long time I doubled wrapped my handlebar. For cushioning, but mainly because I like fat handlebar. It is very thick, even when stretched. If you like your tape thin with minimal cushioning, you should not be looking at a 5 mm thick tape 
The positives:
- Thick and very stretchy.
- Easy to wrap.
- No adhesive. You can wrap and unwrap as many times to get it tidy 
- Despite the lack of adhesive, it wraps well and stay in place once finished. 
- Wider than typical tape, which is likely what you can get away without adhesive
The Negatives:
- Not as sticky as Lizard Skin if you ride w/o gloves in the rain 
- So wide, it takes few tries to get the area around the hood right
review.name: Thick and wide

review.reviewBody: This bar tape is easy to install, and looks clean for how thick it is.  It's grippy enough to ride with out gloves on a hot summer day, and has enough cushion that even the narrowest bars become comfortable.  The self fussing silicon finishing tape actually works and holds after multiple rides, with out the adhesive residue you get from electrical tape.  Best advice though, is since it doesn't come with cheater strips, take it to a shop to wrap your bars or watch a few YouTube videos on how to wrap with out cheater strips.
review.name: Hands down the best bar tape!

name: Supple Bar Tape

review.reviewBody:
Ordered these to replace the same shoe. Great shoe. 

Unfortunately Backcountry sent a pair that had peeling rubber along the seams that I did not notice until I wore them the first time which was about a month after receiving them and thus did not qualify for a return even though I was sent a messed up pair. I should have looked closer as they didn't arrive in the original Butora shoe box, rather a generic Backcounty/competitive cyclist one which I'm assuming meant someone else had already returned them...

Attempting to follow up with Butora as Backcountry said they don't handle the warrantees.
review.name: Shoes are great, Backcountry was not

review.reviewBody:
Not sure why there aren’t more reviews, I’m on my 4-5th pair and want to add my two cents. The rubber is some of the softest I’ve had in climbing shoes which makes it comfy to wear longer and also helps with smearing and jamming which would otherwise be difficult in downturned shoes. The softness makes them harder to use outside where feet tend to be smaller and I want the pushing power I get with harder rubber.

I downsize my outside shoes (Scarpa Boostic), but these shoes are true to my street shoe size of 11.5-12.
review.name: Great indoor shoe

review.reviewBody: I've been meaning to talk to some people about this, and I'm fairly new to the aggressive style climbing shoes, but after trying on several sizes of the Wide fit Butora Acros, I decided to buy a size 9, and I wear an 8.5 street shoe. My previous pair of shoes were La Sportiva Tarantulaces that are size 8.5 and they fit quite comfortably with a little room in them. My Acros fit really snug to my foot which is nice, but even at a half size up, they still squeeze my big toes on both feet quite a bit, and I often find them painful to wear and have to take my heel out after every climb. And if I'm stuck on a lead or top rope route, then I just have to endure the pain until I'm finished. I don't know if I still need to break them in more, or if this is what aggressive shoes are like, but I see people going sizes down from their street shoe and I'm wondering why even at a bigger size my feet are in so much pain.
review.name: Very Useful but Often Painful
comment:
Give scarpas a try. They have some good ones for wide feet too. Personally I love the Acro. Fits me well. In fact I sized down compared to normal and glad I did. 

Aggressive shoes are hard to get used to. Took me a while wearing my original evolv shamans around the house to get comfy with em and now I?ve never looked back. 

Best of luck.

If you?re at a point where you have to ?endure? the pain more than focusing on the climbing, then maybe this shoe is too small or perhaps you would benefit from trying on other shoes.

I bought about three kinds of aggressive shoes and downsized, but I never actually broke any of them in because the pain was too much. I went back to my flat, ?beginner? shoes, with toes only slightly curled and zero pain (even when they were new) and found that climbing pain free helped me focus more on technique and strength building. Hope this helped you out.

name: Acro Wide Fit Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: My 1st pair I received as a gift. I also hate sunscreen (yuk-gross). Never wore either in the arid, high-altitude NM sun until my colleague showed me his melanoma removal scar. I now purchased a 2nd pair of sun sleeves and wear them religiously. I was skeptical of sleeves in the sun but they are quite comfortable and can add to cooling if they are doused with water. I highly recommend them if you are looking for high SPF protection from the sun. (ps- I now begrudgingly apply sunscreen to my face, ears & neck)
review.name: Actually quite comfortable

review.reviewBody:
After years of using various sticky/smelly sunscreen, I decided to give these a try.  All I can say is WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG???

A simple & clean solution for those of us in sunny climes.  Protects me from the West Texas sun and even the West Texas blowing dust that stings the legs but not the arms! No problem at all wearing these in high heat and I have also used them on chilly mornings.  I greatly prefer using these to sunscreen and on chilly mornings instead of a long-sleeve jersey (remove them when the heat arrives).

I wear them twice daily and wash them weekly.  They appear to be very durable.  I have moved from size large to size medium for a tighter fit around the upper arm - no complaints.  I wear the white version.  AWESOME!!!
review.name: WAY Better Than Sunscreen!!!

review.reviewBody: I bought the white sleeve, fits true to size and is comfortable and stays up. I tend to run cold when I ride and overdress but these feel very hot for the first 30 minutes or so of the ride until I start to sweat and then I don't notice it as much, but it always does feel a little warm. I would not go so far as to say it is " cooling". I've worn it in temperatures from 68° up to 85° f and when it gets close to that temperature I'm constantly thinking about taking them off. I've been wearing sunscreen under just in case. I definitely won't be wearing them for rides above 80 or 85 so that means I'm only using them for a short part of every year as I have warmer sleeves for colder weather.  I still haven't decided if it's worth the cost for that short time of usage.
review.name: Works well in moderate heat

review.reviewBody: I prefer not to ride when the sun is straight up.  These sleeves will definitely expand my options.  I can also see the sleeves as an arm warmer when there is just a touch of coolness in the air.  My purchase was a medium and are a bit long.  But it's impossible to get a product like this to fit every arm perfectly.  These will work just fine.
review.name: A great accessory as we get older.

review.reviewBody:
I've had these sun sleeves for a few years now and they are very good in that they keep my arms protected from the sun and don't feel too hot.  The one complaint I have about these is that the seam at the upper band can sometimes be a little irritating.  It's not a very big deal, but occasionally I have to fiddle with them to keep that stitching from itching.

Edit: I fixed this issue by ever-so-slightly melting the sharp corner with a lighter. Please don?t burn your house down.
review.name: These are good sun sleeves with one flaw

name: Sun Sleeve

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I waited to review these boots until I put some miles on them.  These are the best fit and quality of boot.  I own a couple of other Simms boots, and these are so much better.  My feet don't hurt after a day of walking and fishing.
review.name: Best Simms Boots Ever

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Most comfortable and supportive boot I ever worn. No break in period and got the whoa factor after just a few hours of going over dicey terrain with them. Without a doubt, a large gap between these and any other boot I've used.
review.name: Best boot I've ever fished in!

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super supportive boots and very comfortable out of the box.  If there's a nicer wading boot out there,  I haven't seen it.  We'll built and durable as well. Thank you!
review.name: Best wading boots around

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Well I did like the gear.. member since 2009...but quality is poor g4 boot 1 season sole came apart.. i have a 6 year old pair that look better than the 1 year old pair don't wast your money on simms gear sent a jacket in for repair for a zipper thy said could not be fixed idk simms not the same too bad..
review.name: Dont wast your money...........Quality control .....

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: They are an awesome boot grab on the bottom of the river is very well

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: The felt boot came with TPR studs installed.  Attempted to replace with the aluminum studs provided and they simply don’t fit   Impossible to get them in there   Extremely frustrating must be a flaw   I’ll be sending them back but I’m out awaiting boot again for another month at least   Severely disappointing for the amount you pay for these boots.
review.name: Aluminum cleats don’t fit

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great boots, sturdy, light and amazing traction on both wet and dry rocks. worth the money for sure !
review.name: Awesome boot

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: should have upgraded years ago. light. comfortable. rugged. an incredible wading boot. the aluminum studs do wear down with HEAVY use. but i walked 16 miles in these boots over slipper rocks and could have slept in them. couldn't ask for a better boot.

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Amazing wading boot! Beyond comfortable for an extended period of time...love the wide toe box and surprisingly grippy aluminum discs on slick rock!
review.name: These are keepers!

review.itemreviewed: G4 PRO Powerlock Boot - Felt - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is Simms best boot yet.  I was unsure of how the new cleat system would hold up, but after a week of fishing in Norway I am a believer!  I didn’t slip a single time.  The boots are comfortable and were very supportive during long days on the water.  I highly recommend them!
review.name: Simms best boot yet

review.reviewBody:
Most arm warmers are sized based upon arm length and bicep circumference, Castelli’s guide just has overall weight ranges, which are useless.

I ordered these in size M and L to see which would fit best, My bicep measures 12-13 inches in diameter, arm length from wrist to upper bicep is about 17 inches.

The medium size could barely be pulled on, the super-tight silicone upper cuff cut off my circulation, but the overall length was about right.

The large size was too long and bunched up, and the upper cuff was still tight and annoying, it tends to roll under, hard to get it to lay flat.

Returned both.
review.name: No Size Guide, Very Tight Upper Cuff

name: Thermoflex 2 Arm Warmer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] In stock, shipped fast and as described. Thank you.
review.name: Mosquito Head Nets

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We use the head nets all the time for outdoor activities (gardening, tending the chickens, walking the dogs, yardwork) this summer. The woods mosquitos are brutal. The nets with regular mesh are fine for keeping them at bay. They are easy to carry in a pocket as a contingency. They have saved us countless bottles of Deep Woods Off.
review.name: Indispensable in a wet summer

review.reviewBody: This thing is absolutely amazing. Saved me from going insane on several backpacking trips so far. It saved my face from the relentless mosquitos of the Olympic Rainforest and the Wind Rivers of Wyoming. The second I put it on it was instant relief from the thousands of mosquitos buzzing my face. Weighs nothing and is just amazing.
review.name: Must Have Item

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Haven’t had the opportunity or need to use the mosquito head net yet….actually hope I don’t need it, ha. But I’m happy to have a line of defense for the black flies and mosquitos this Spring and Summer!
review.name: Haven’t had the opportunity or

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Was one of the most used items on my last backpacking trip in Yosemite!!
review.name: Was one of the most

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] At first, it seemed silly to wear this over your head while sitting around a campfire, but it didn’t amtake long to realize that as the mozzie’s were buzzing around, they couldn’t get you. Getting bit on the arm or leg is one thing, but on your face? No thank you!

Small enough to toss it in any backpack. I recommend!
review.name: At first, it seemed silly

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it, but wish you would have kept them the same size as the ones I bought a few years ago. It’s 1” smaller, and no longer fits well over my large sun hat.
review.name: Love it, but wish you

review.reviewBody: This mosquito head net is lightweight and easily adjusts over my hat. Most importantly, it keeps the mosquitoes off my face. I purchased the mosquito net with the added bug repellent. This has helped me relax more while hunting. Its a good thing to have in my hunter's jacket.
review.name: This mosquito head net is

review.reviewBody: Well, it's a head net. It keeps the bugs off of your face and works best with a hat to keep the netting away from your face. If you venture into buggy places, give it a try.
review.name: keeps the bugs off

review.reviewBody: This little piece of detail is mighty in its ability to keep that irritating flies off your face and neck. Was easy to carry and stays on the brim of the hat. Highly recommended. The product detail and delivery was as smooth as can be.
review.name: Small but mighty
